meanings.definition: To write or inscribe on a scroll.
meanings.sent1: She carefully enscrolls her name on the ancient scroll.
meanings.sent2: The scribe decided to enscroll the important message on the parchment.
meanings.sent3: The wizard enscrolls a spell on the magical scroll, but it keeps unraveling comically.
meanings.sent4: His memories enscroll themselves on the pages of his mind like an endless scroll.
meanings.sent5: The artist enscrolls intricate designs on the delicate scroll, creating a masterpiece.

meanings.definition: To record or document in a scroll.
meanings.sent1: The historian enscrolls the events of the battle on the ancient scroll.
meanings.sent2: In ancient times, people used to enscroll important information on scrolls.
meanings.sent3: The detective enscrolls the suspect's alibi on a mysterious scroll found at the crime scene.
meanings.sent4: Her emotions enscroll themselves on the pages of her diary like a secret scroll.
meanings.sent5: The poet enscrolls the beauty of nature on the parchment, capturing its essence forever.

meanings.definition: To enroll or register in a list.
meanings.sent1: Students enscroll their names in the class list at the beginning of the semester.
meanings.sent2: The organization decided to enscroll new members in the official register.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel enscrolls itself in the list of animals causing trouble in the garden.
meanings.sent4: His dedication to the cause enscrolls him in the history of heroes like a legendary name.
meanings.sent5: The explorer enscrolls his adventures in the logbook, marking each discovery with excitement.
